title: Deloitte buys Aussie tech firm in its largest ever local consulting deal
text:
Deloitte has acquired consulting practice and SAP and Oracle partner, Presence of IT, in a move that will see its human capital team almost double in size.

While the deal's details are not public, it is Deloitte's largest ever consulting transaction in Australia and Presence of IT's most recent financial statement puts the value of its consolidated revenue at over $122 million.

Richard Deutsch says the deal makes Deloitte the "undisputed leaders in human capital consulting" Peter Braig

The firm delivered profits of $4.6 million for the 2017 financial year, but recorded a loss of almost $3.5 million the year prior.

The acquisition will see over 300 people join its Austalian office and 300 come aboard across the Asia Pacific and US. There are currently 440 people employed in the ANZ human capital arm.

Presence of IT's two co-founders, David Brookes and Shaun Flannery, and co-CEO Shane Grobler will become partners in Deloitte's Australian human capital team.
description: The acquisition of the $122 million consulting firm will see Deloitte's human capital practice almost double in employees.
